terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.footerNote: By using our services, you agree to these terms and conditions in full.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance
acceptance.content: The use of ParKpool services implies full and unconditional acceptance of these Terms and Conditions by Valet Parking Companies and end users.

scope.title: 2. Scope of Service
scope.content:
MVP - B2B Operation: SaaS platform for reservation management, queues, personnel, and payments.

Future Phases - B2C Operation: Direct interface with end user, including autonomous requests, payment history, additional services, and Fixit ecosystem.

custody.title: 3. Custody and Responsibility
custody.content:
Responsibility begins only when the vehicle is formally received and the digital entry ticket is generated.

Incidents occurring in the waiting line before check-in are not the responsibility of ParKpool or the Operator.

The user grants a tacit mandate when handing over the keys, authorizing the Valet to drive and safeguard the vehicle.

Custody ends when the vehicle is delivered and marked as "Checked Out" in the system.

evidence.title: 4. Photographic Evidence
evidence.content:
The Valet must capture at least two photographs of the vehicle at check-in.

These images constitute legal evidence in case of claims for pre-existing damage or scratches.

The user accepts that this evidence takes precedence over subsequent claims without additional support.

payments.title: 5. Rates and Payments
payments.content:
Rates are defined by the Valet Company and configured in the system.

The user accepts the rates before making the payment, which is made through a digital link (e.g., Stripe).

Additional payments for complementary services (washing, charging, assistance) will be previously informed and accepted.

ParKpool is not responsible for failures in external payment gateways.

liability.title: 6. Limitation of Liability
liability.content:
ParKpool is not responsible for damages derived from force majeure, user negligence, or incidents outside the custody period.

In future services such as "Designated Driver" or "Valet On-Demand", extra-contractual civil liability will be covered by specific insurance policies.

ParKpool does not guarantee continuous service availability, being able to suspend it for maintenance or updates.

userObligations.title: 7. User Obligations
userObligations.content:
Provide truthful and complete information about the vehicle.

Do not deliver vehicles with serious mechanical failures that may put the operation at risk.

Comply with safety and coexistence rules in service areas.

clientObligations.title: 8. Client Obligations (Valet Company)
clientObligations.content:
Train their personnel in the correct use of the platform.

Ensure the veracity of the information registered in the system.

Comply with labor and safety regulations applicable to operational personnel.

privacy.title: 9. Personal Data Policy
privacy.content:
ParKpool collects and retains data such as license plate, name, and phone number of the user.

The user expressly authorizes the use of their data for cross-commercial purposes with Fixit ecosystem partners (insurance, maintenance, roadside assistance).

Data may be retained as "qualified leads" even after the service has ended.

Profile enrichment will be applied for marketing segmentation, always within the legal limits of the Florida Information Protection Act (FIPA) and other applicable privacy laws in the U.S.

The user may exercise their rights of access, rectification, and deletion of data in accordance with current Florida legislation.

intellectualProperty.title: 10. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: All software, trademarks, and content associated with ParKpool are the exclusive property of the company and may not be reproduced without authorization.

modifications.title: 11. Modifications
modifications.content: ParKpool may update these Terms and Conditions at any time, notifying clients and users. Continued use of the service implies acceptance of the modifications.

jurisdiction.title: 12. Jurisdiction and Applicable Law
jurisdiction.content:
These Terms and Conditions are governed by the laws of the State of Florida, United States of America.

Any dispute shall be resolved before the competent state or federal courts located in Miami-Dade County, Florida.

The user and the Client expressly waive any other jurisdiction that may correspond to them.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.footerNote: Your privacy is important to us. Please review this policy to understand how we collect and use your information.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: This Privacy Policy describes how ParKpool ("we", "us", or "our") collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our valet parking services.

dataCollection.title: 2. Data Collection
dataCollection.content:
We collect the following information:

• Personal identification: Name, phone number, email address
• Vehicle information: License plate, make, model, color, year
• Service usage: Check-in/check-out times, parking duration, payment information
• Photos: Vehicle condition at check-in and check-out
• Location data: When using our mobile services

dataUse.title: 3. How We Use Your Data
dataUse.content:
Your information is used to:

• Provide valet parking services
• Process payments and manage reservations
• Communicate about your service
• Improve our platform and services
• Comply with legal requirements
• Marketing purposes (with your consent)

dataSharing.title: 4. Data Sharing
dataSharing.content:
We may share your data with:

• Valet parking operators providing the service
• Payment processors (Stripe)
• Fixit ecosystem partners for cross-marketing (with consent)
• Legal authorities when required by law

We do not sell your personal information to third parties.

dataRetention.title: 5. Data Retention
dataRetention.content:
We retain your data:

• For active accounts: Until account deletion
• For transaction records: 7 years for tax purposes
• For marketing leads: Until you opt out
• Photos and inspections: 2 years for liability purposes

yourRights.title: 6. Your Rights
yourRights.content:
Under Florida law, you have the right to:

• Access your personal data
• Correct inaccurate information
• Delete your data (subject to legal requirements)
• Opt out of marketing communications
• Data portability

To exercise these rights, contact legal@parkpool.com

security.title: 7. Data Security
security.content:
We implement appropriate security measures including:

• Encryption of sensitive data
• Secure payment processing
• Regular security audits
• Limited access to personal information
• Secure data storage and transmission

cookies.title: 8. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.content:
We use cookies and similar technologies to:

• Remember your preferences
• Analyze website usage
• Provide personalized experiences
• Ensure platform security

You can manage cookie preferences in your browser settings.

changes.title: 9. Policy Changes
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. We will notify you of significant changes through email or platform notifications. Continued use of our services constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: 10. Contact Information
contact.content:
